tasks: Design of an FPGA-based USB 3.0 device controller
methods: Using FPGA resources to implement a serial interface engine and USB PHY
results: USB 3.0 speed more than 320 MB/s for bulk-in and bulk-out transfers
title: Design of an FPGA-based USB 3.0 device controller
abstract: The traditional USB 3.0 communication based on FPGA uses an external chip as a USB PHY or a USB controller including a USB PHY. This paper realizes a USB 3.0 controller by using FPGA resources, in which FPGA logic realizes a serial interface engine, and an FPGA internal transceiver is as a USB PHY. Used slices percent after implementation is 4.59% in Kintex-7 325t. The test result shows that the speed of USB 3.0 is more than 320 MB/s bulk-in and bulk-out transfers.
